verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of David,<WH1732> to bring<WH2142> to remembrance.<WH2142> O lord,<WH3068> rebuke<WH3198> me not in your wrath:<WH7110> neither chasten<WH3256> me in your hot<WH2534> displeasure.<WH2534>
For your arrows<WH2671> stick<WH5181> fast in me, and your hand<WH3027> presses<WH5181> me sore.
There is no<WH369> soundness<WH4974> in my flesh<WH1320> because<WH6440> of your anger;<WH2195> neither<WH369> is there any rest<WH7965> in my bones<WH6106> because<WH6440> of my sin.<WH2403>
For my iniquities<WH5771> are gone<WH5674> over<WH5674> my head:<WH7218> as an heavy<WH3515> burden<WH4853> they are too heavy<WH3513> for me.
My wounds<WH2250> stink<WH887> and are corrupt<WH4743> because<WH6440> of my foolishness.<WH200>
I am troubled;<WH5753> I am bowed<WH7817> down<WH7817> greatly;<WH3966> I go<WH1980> mourning<WH6937> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long.
For my loins<WH3689> are filled<WH4390> with a loathsome<WH7033> disease: and there is no<WH369> soundness<WH4974> in my flesh.<WH1320>
I am feeble<WH6313> and sore<WH5704> <WH3966> broken:<WH1794> I have roared<WH7580> by reason of the disquietness<WH5100> of my heart.<WH3820>
Lord,<WH136> all<WH3605> my desire<WH8378> is before<WH5048> you; and my groaning<WH585> is not hid<WH5641> from you.
My heart<WH3820> pants,<WH5503> my strength<WH3581> fails<WH5800> me: as for the light<WH216> of my eyes,<WH5869> it also<WH1571> is gone<WH369> from me.
My lovers<WH157> and my friends<WH7453> stand<WH5975> aloof<WH5048> from my sore;<WH5061> and my kinsmen<WH7138> stand<WH5975> afar<WH7350> off.

They also that seek<WH1245> after my life<WH5315> lay snares<WH5367> for me: and they that seek<WH1875> my hurt<WH7451> speak<WH1696> mischievous<WH1942> things, and imagine<WH1897> deceits<WH4820> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long.
But I, as a deaf<WH2795> man, heard<WH8085> not; and I was as a dumb<WH483> man that opens<WH6605> not his mouth.<WH6310>
Thus I was as a man<WH376> that hears<WH8085> not, and in whose mouth<WH6310> are no<WH369> reproofs.<WH8433>
For in you, O LORD,<WH3068> do I hope:<WH3176> you will hear,<WH6030> O Lord<WH136> my God.<WH430>
For I said,<WH559> Hear<WH6030> me, lest<WH6435> otherwise they should rejoice<WH8056> over me: when my foot<WH7272> slips,<WH4131> they magnify<WH1431> themselves against<WH5921> me.
For I am ready<WH3559> to halt,<WH6761> and my sorrow<WH4341> is continually<WH8548> before<WH5048> me.
For I will declare<WH5046> my iniquity;<WH5771> I will be sorry<WH1672> for my sin.<WH2403>
But my enemies<WH341> are lively,<WH2416> and they are strong:<WH6105> and they that hate<WH8130> me wrongfully<WH8267> are multiplied.<WH7231>
They also that render<WH7999> evil<WH7451> for good<WH2896> are my adversaries;<WH7853> because<WH8478> I follow<WH7291> the thing that good<WH2896> is.
Forsake<WH5800> me not, O LORD:<WH3068> O my God,<WH430> be not far<WH7368> from me.
Make haste<WH2363> to help<WH5833> me, O Lord<WH136> my salvation.<WH8668>
